summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL Supervisor Rounds log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, covering rounds conducted on August 9 and 10, 2019. It documents routine security checks, including checks of the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and a 'SUICIDE RM', in the days immediately preceding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

events.title: Prison Supervisor Rounds
events.description: Multiple rounds of security checks were conducted by lieutenants at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, throughout the day and evening watches.

events.title: Prison Supervisor Rounds
events.description: Multiple rounds of security checks were conducted by lieutenants at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, throughout the morning, day, and evening watches, including checks of a 'SUICIDE RM'.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC New York)
keyFacts: This document is a prison supervisor's rounds log for August 9-10, 2019, the two days before Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell on August 10, 2019.
The log shows routine security checks were conducted in areas including the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and a room designated 'SUICIDE RM'.
The checks were performed by lieutenants across morning, day, and evening watches, indicating standard operating procedure.
The document is part of the TRUINTEL system, labeled 'Sensitive But Unclassified', and was generated by the Federal Bureau of Prisons.
No specific individuals are named in the log entries; it records only shift times, locations, and officer ranks.
